channel.title: CVE Feed for Trend Micro -- Trend Micro Antivirus for Mac (Consumer)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Trend Micro -- Trend Micro Antivirus for Mac (Consumer)

item.title: CVE-2018-18329|2024-08-05T11:08:21.796Z -- trend%20micro -- trend%20micro%20antivirus%20for%20mac%20%28consumer%29
item.description: A KERedirect Untrusted Pointer Dereference Privilege Escalation vulnerability in Trend Micro Antivirus for Mac (Consumer) 7.0 (2017) and above could allow a local attacker to escalate privileges on vulnerable installations. The issue results from the lack of proper validation function on 0x6F4E offset user-supplied buffer. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.

item.description: A KERedirect Untrusted Pointer Dereference Privilege Escalation vulnerability in Trend Micro Antivirus for Mac (Consumer) 7.0 (2017) and above could allow a local attacker to escalate privileges on vulnerable installations. The issue results from the lack of proper validation function on 0x6F6A offset user-supplied buffer. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
